_prev_prog_3.Description: Storage of Liquid Fertilizer for use in Crop Production

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, Ks.



Operation is committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Salina facility is prepared to work with the Saline County LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact to people and the environment.



The Salina facility's primary covered process activity is the storage of fertilizers.  This activity includes processing of anhydrous ammonia by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.  Anhydrous ammonia is received and processed into 10-34-0 non-hazardous liquid fertilizer.  Processing is periodic and usually occurs in the Spring and Fall.  Ammonia mixing with phosphoric acid occurs in a T-reactor owned and operated by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.  Water is used as both a reaction feed material and product stabilizer.  The emergency procedures for Salina are coordinated with the Saline County LEPC.



United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, Ks has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  This process conducted at our Salina location is done entirely by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC; and their process is also covered by OSHA's Process Safety Management standard.  The following briefly describes the prevention program elements in place at this location using Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC mobile T-Recator equipment:



Process Safety Information:  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC maintains information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the covered process.



Process Hazard Analysis:  Studies are conducted to ensure the hazards associated with process operations are identified, understood and controlled.



Operating Procedures:  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC; written operating procedur

es are maintained for covered process operations.  The Contractors procedures address the following activities:   initial startup, normal, temporary, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown and startup following a turnaround.



Hot Work Permits:  In order to assure adequate controls are used in work where conditions could cause ignition or flammable or combustible materials, the Hot Work Permit System will be utilized.  Hot work involves any welding, soldering, cutting, grinding, drilling, or any type of work where sparks may occur during operation.  These permits will be utilized where Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC supervisor deems them necessary for job safety.  It will be the supervisor's responsibility to ensure the proper procedures are followed and keep the appropriate records.



Training:  A program is in place to ensure employee(s) Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC are knowledgeable and trained in procedures associated with the covered processes.  Verification of contractor training has been documented.



Mechanical Integrity:  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC covered process equipment is maintained consistent with generally accepted engineering practices.  Covered process equipment is routinely inspected and tested.  Maintenance activities are conducted by qualified personnel.  Deficiencies are corrected in a timely manner.



Management of Change:  Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and/or procedures.  Affected personnel are informed and trained to deal with authorized system changes.



Pre-Startup Review:  Technical and operational reviews will be conducted on new processes and/or modifications to existing covered processes.  Reviews confirm the construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable.  Reviews are completed prior to placing equipment in operation.



Compliance Audits:  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC & United Suppliers, Inc conduct internal audits on

a regular basis to determine whether the provisions specified under the RMP rule are being implemented.  At a minimum, these audits are conducted every three (3) years.  Any determined corrective actions are completed in a timely manner.



Incident Investigations:  If an Incident were to occur, investigations would be conducted to determine the root cause of covered process incidents.  In addition to determination and correction, investigations are directed toward preventing a reoccurrence.  Investigations become process safety information and are retained for five (5) years.  United Suppliers, Inc. Risk Management department resides at Eldora, providing additional incident investigation support for Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.



Employee Participation:  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC employee(s) actively contribute in the following:  process hazard assessments, operating procedure development, maintenance procedure development, training development and implementation, pre-startup reviews, incident investigations, and compliance audits.  Additionally, employee(s) have access to all information pertaining to the facility's RMP.



Contractors:  Periodically, Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC may hire contractors to conduct specialized operational, maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to work, contractors are trained on the covered processes, relevant process safety information and emergency response actions.



Five (5) Year Accident History:  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.  Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.



Emergency Action Plan:  United Suppliers, Inc. - Salina, Ks. Has a written emergency action plan.  This plan includes notification of the Saline County LEPC.  Local authorities have been provided w

ith emergency planning and community right-to-know information.  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC also has their own Emergency Action Plan.



Planned changes to improve safety:  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC views safety improvement as a continual process.  Periodic evaluations (both internal and external) are performed to assess the facility status.  At this time, and aside from sustaining maintenance activities, there are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding anhydrous ammonia.  This information is also reviewed by United Suppliers, Inc.
